snippet: Official results showed that the incumbent won outright, but Aleksei A. Navalny accused the authorities of stealing votes and called for a recount.
abstract: Surprisingly strong finish in Moscow mayoral race by anti-Putin opposition leader Aleksei A Navalny is convincing enough to assure him new credibility as a mainstream political contender; result also positions Navalny to continue to accuse authorities of fraud and corruption; city election officials declare incumbent Mayor Sergei S Sobyanin won the election outright.

byline.contributor: Noah Sneider, Andrew Roth and Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Official results showed that the incumbent won outright, but Aleksei A. Navalny accused the authorities of stealing votes and called for a recount.

headline.main: Shy of Runoff, Challenger Demands Recounts in Moscow Mayoral Race
headline.print_headline: Shy of Runoff, Challenger Demands Recounts in Moscow Mayoral Race
